title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: This one came in after a battery replacement claiming they have no power when the battery is plugged in, but intermittent power when the battery is unplugged. I can confirm this every other time I plug in the charger I get a green light and fan spin, but every other time I get no green light and no fan spin. PP3V42: 3.42 PPBUS: 12.28 volts. No power ever with battery plugged in. Is this a dead SMC or should I look elsewhere? Was liquid damage near the DC in port and fuse easy to scrub away with alcohol and toothbrush as no components were burned.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Also tried known good DC in board same result.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message:
Also when I get green light and fan spin, PPBUS is literally zero volts. I have no idea how.
Check that 12.58 volts

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message:
Update, now it's magically working off the battery.... any insight is appreciated because idk what the fuck is going on with this lmao\

I got it to work a few times off the battery now it is not. I hate to keep spamming this, but I just want to give as much detail as possible

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: SMC seems to be not starting all the time or the power button is putting it in bypass mode. Disconnect keyboard and try again, check SMC_RESET and SMC_ONOFF.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: I measured originally without the keyboard attached. Without keyboard attached: SMC_RESET_L: 3.4 SMC_ONOFF_L: 3.4 volts. PPBUS gives me weird measurements too like 0.8 volts with a 3 Millionohms resistance to ground then once and a while 12.28 volts then when the board actually kicks on its 12.58 volts.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: SMC is not starting. Check for corrosion around SMC and the rest of the board.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Ok will do when I get back tomorrow. Board looks really clean but kinda looks like it was Ultrasoniced previously. Would reflowing SMC be a good idea?

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: No real signs of liquid so will reflow SMC and see what happens.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message:
Ok so after reflow now I'm getting weird readings. 

PP3V42: 3.42 volts
PPBUS_G3H:  0.35 volts
SYS_ONEWIRE: 0 volts
ADAPTER_SENSE: 0 volts
SMC_BCAC_OK: 0 volts

I get 3.42 volts on the SMBUS pins on the ISL
PPCHRG_DCIN: 18 volts
PP5v1 charger: 5.1 volts. 

Is this an SMC issue or could this be an ISL issue? I just want to be sure before I go and replace the SMC. The computer was brought in with a knockoff charger btw, so I was curious from the start if it wasn't SMC related.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message:
No corrosion around the SMC area btw that I could see was obvious

ISL area my bad. Current sense resistors for both charger and battery measure good

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Oh and no short to ground on PPBUS resistance to ground is 6 million ohms

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: 6 milli Ohm is pretty much a short in my book.....you sure about this?

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Isn't a high resistance to ground not a short tho?

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Ok I'm educated now lol my bad. Going to look for short guessing on creation side in this instance

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Ok so no short it's gone. But I still only get 1 volt on PPBUS.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: First thing you need is green light. Seems like your ACOK is gone so that is where you should look first. The usual checks on U7000, ACIN, DCIN, resistance between pins 17/18 27/28. Make sure this stuff is discharged! That is why you are measuring a "short" which later is gone. This is a good way to fry stuff with charge left on PPBUS.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Ok will do. DC in when I measured at work was 18 volts. Will check ACIN and the resistance measurements when I get back to work Monday

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message:
DCIN: 18 volts
ACIN: 18 volts
Resistance between pins 17 and 18 is 4.2 ohms
Resistance between pins 27 and 28 is 21.2 ohms

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: ACIN on U7000 can never be 18V. ACIN, ACOK? 3V42 present?

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message:
My bad ACIN: zero volts
ACOK also missing but 3v42 is 3.42 volts

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: R7010 and R7011 are definitely blown both measure way below what they should.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Resistors don't blow and get lower in resistance. Measure some voltages around there, also DCIN on U7000

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: DCIN: on U7000 is 18 volts. DCIN on Pin 1 of R7010 is 18 volts AC in is zero anywhere I measure

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Pins 10-12 measure 3.42 volts

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: SMC_RESET_L also 3.3

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Ok so R7010 measures normal I went back and remeasured to make sure. R7011 only measures 2.9 ohms which is not correct. Continuity from R7011 to ISL.

title: 820-3332 Intermittent power/green light
message: Replaced ISL and that resistor and it looks to be good to go. I'll call this good for now
